positions.title: Research Intern
positions.companyName: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard
positions.description:
- Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) for representation learning of microscopic cell images,
- Produced state-of-the-art results for synthesizing cell images,
- Paper accepted at the workshop on Machine Learning in Computational Biology at NIPS 2017.

positions.title: Software Engineering Intern
positions.description:
- Optimized a highly distributed realtime logging framework at the core of Facebook infra.
- Doubled throughput, redesigned major parts of the codebase and greatly improved test coverage.
- Participated in the release, monitoring and debugging of our code on more than a million machines.
- Hacked on codesearch tooling during a hackathon and shipped it to production.

Selected as one of 13 out of many thousand interns to have dinner with Mark Zuckerberg.

Worked mostly in C++ and a little Python and PHP/Hack.
…
see more

positions.title: Software Engineering Intern
positions.description:
- Added functionality to the Instant Bloomberg (IB) messaging system to trace messages across every hop.
- Wrote a network traffic simulation tool that produces messages to Apache Kafka message queue clusters.
- Included a mathematical expression lexer and parser to model traffic according to functions of time.
- Integrated the clang-tidy static analyzer with our build system.
- Visualized latency and message type distribution in our systems in Splunk dashboards.
- Gave a training seminar about LLVM and clang to ~30 Bloomberg engineers.

Wrote code in C++, Java, Bash and Python and learnt about Apache Kafka.

positions.title: Software Engineering Intern
positions.description:
- Built chatbots in Go, using the natural language processing engine inside Google’s Allo app.
- Built a web platform that showcases Google's ad technologies in a realistic environment.
- Wrote reference implementations of how to fetch and display ads from Google’s ads servers (DFP).
- Open-sourced an integration of Google’s GPT ad-serving JavaScript library with AngularJS, under an official Google GitHub organization, on my own initiative.

Wrote code in Go, Python, JavaScript, AngularJS and Polymer.

positions.title: Research Assistant
positions.description:
Investigated the efficiency of various inter-process communication techniques for low-latency transmission of database queries at the chair for database systems. Involved low-level system programming in C and C++, benchmarking the latency of pipes, sockets and shared memory. We developed a library that transparently replaces domain socket system calls with a custom shared memory transmission channel which can speed up a variety of programs by an order of magnitude. Using the library I worked on, Postgres runs around 2x faster.
…
see more

positions.title: Research Assistant
positions.description:
I gathered my first work experience at the Institute for Networked and Embedded Systems at the University of Klagenfurt in July 2014, where I worked on Non-Intrusive-Load-Monitoring (NILM) algorithms for energy-disaggregation based on real-time Particle Filtering on a UDOO development Board. I implemented the load-disaggregation algorithms with Python, C++ and SQLite3; visualized them in a web-app with Python, Flask, Heroku, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS and Javascript and sourced appliance data using Arduino, C and Bash.

given.text: Peter worked as intern in my team at Bloomberg, working primarily on our C++ backend systems. He is smart, motivated and has an impressive programming ability. I enjoyed working with Peter, and would be very keen to work with him again in the future.

As an intern in Engineering department in Bloomberg, Peter had a number of responsibilities. He worked on a number of improvements on a C++ backend and he managed to successfully finish every one of these challenges. He is proficient in C++, Python and Java, has deep knowledge on Data Structures and Algorithms. Besides purely technical skills he is very productive, smart, result oriented. Last but not least Peter is a well-spoken person.
…

Peter and I were working on a system level library at TUM during the summer of 2016. His outstanding motivation and dedication towards computer science and the project itself were more than inspiring. Not only is he an ace programmer, no matter which language you through at him, his skills in researching and analyzing a problem are excellent. He has my highest respect as a colleague and a person - I would always rehire him.

I had the pleasure to work with Peter during is research internships at AAU in summer 2014 and 2015. He is goal-oriented and a very promising student, fluent in C/C++ and Python, as well as keen on embedded systems. He is very eager in learning and trying out new technical things, still he gets his work done!

received.text: I worked in the same team as Ed during my internship at Bloomberg. During my time there, he was always happy to help me with design decisions and technical discussions and his knowledge of the Bloomberg ecosystem and C++ were of great help to me. It was a pleasure to work with him.

Dzhem helped me a tremendous amount during my internship at Bloomberg, mentoring me, helping me with design decisions and sharing his experience with me whenever he could. Dzhem has an incredibly deep understanding of algorithms, data structures, concurrency and especially large-scale software design. It was a pleasure to work with him.
